post.description: Basic interface for submiting data into the Data Lake.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description:
The date and time that the request was originated. The format is defined by [Section 7.1.1.1 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
**NOTE:** That's the only place where we don't use [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for date-time value, just because we can't and have to be compliant with the orthodox HTTP standard.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The identification string of user agent (browser, application, etc). The format is defined by [Section 5.5.3 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3).

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: List of acceptable human languages for response. The format is defined by [Section 5.3.5 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3.5).

parameters.name: X-HTTP-Method-Override
parameters.description: Put here the HTTP method you want, when making call by the POST method to avoid interference of nasty firewall rules (read [this](https://www.hanselman.com/blog/HTTPPUTOrDELETENotAllowedUseXHTTPMethodOverrideForYourRESTServiceWithASPNETWebAPI.aspx)).

parameters.name: Content-Length
parameters.description: Content-Length header is only required for requests with Content-Type header 'application/octet-stream'

parameters.name: Content-Disposition
parameters.description: Content-Disposition header is only required for requests with Content-Type header 'application/octet-stream'

parameters.name: X-HPACK
parameters.description: Specify this header if you want all X-Capture headers to be similar to the request where you took the term parameter from the response body. If this header is specified there is no need to set X-Capture headers directly.

parameters.name: X-Source-Footprint
parameters.description: The source settings snapshot that may identify 3rd party system

parameters.name: X-Source-VCS
parameters.description: Version control system details of the source

parameters.name: X-Capture-Coordinates-Key
parameters.description: The natural key of captured object

parameters.name: X-Capture-Coordinates-Model
parameters.description: The logical model of captured object.

parameters.name: X-Capture-Coordinates-Type
parameters.description: The physical type of captured object

parameters.name: X-Capture-Coordinates-Length
parameters.description: The length of captured object in bytes

parameters.name: X-Capture-Coordinates-Timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp when the captured object has been created or last modified in the 3rd party system in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`

parameters.name: X-Capture-Characteristics
parameters.description: References from captured origin to another origins from 3rd party systems

parameters.name: X-Capture-Taxonomy
parameters.description: The taxonomy of captured object

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Timeframe-Duration
parameters.description: The duration of the 'Timeframe' given in milliseconds or as a string like "4h30m", "1d", etc.

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Timeframe-Start
parameters.description: The start of the 'Timeframe' specified in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Timeframe-End
parameters.description: The start of the 'Timeframe' specified in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Protocol
parameters.description: The protocol that was used for the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Driver
parameters.description: The driver that was used for the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Context
parameters.description: The context that conditioned the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Host
parameters.description: The host that was served the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Endpoint
parameters.description: The endpoint of a system API or file storage or database connection string that was used for the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-Request
parameters.description: The request that was made for the capture

parameters.name: X-Capture-Navigation-VCS
parameters.description: Version control system details of the service that captured the data

parameters.name: X-Capture-Security
parameters.description: The sensitivity and access levels of captured origin from 3rd party system

requestBody.description: By design method cunsumes `any` Content-Type. Disclaimer: not method works with basic content types only: application/json and application/octet-stream.

X-HPACK.description: This header is used to minimize typical request headers count.

post.description: Basic interface for capturing data inside already existed Data Instance.

**NOTE:** That's the only place where we don't use [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for date-time value, just because we can't and have to be compliant with the orthodox HTTP standard.

requestBody.description: By design method cunsumes `any` Content-Type. Disclaimer: not method works with basic content types only: application/json and application/octet-stream.

get.description: Basic interface for streaming RAW origins from Data Lake.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: A timestamp that points to the start of the range of time-based data.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: A timestamp that points to the end of the range of time-based data.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

model.description: The name of model that specifies the object structure.

created.description: The high-precision date/time of object's creation specified in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

modified.description: The high-precision date/time of object's last modification in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

id.description: The ID of the object referenced and described by the `Descriptor`.

url.description: The URL of the described object, which should be used for fetching its contents.

model.description: The model that specifies the structure of the object referenced and described by the `Descriptor`.

display.description: Some descriptive information that represents the object referenced and described by the `Descriptor`.

anyOf.description: A plain text caption that represents the object.

properties.description: Some or all properties of the described object.

url.description: The URL of the `Collection`, which should be used for fetching data from it.

count.description: The count of elements in the `Collection` (if it's countable).

top.description: The list of top N elements in the `Collection` (when provided).

mk-MK.description: FYRO Macedonian (Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia)

slug.description: The user-friendly and URL-valid name. [Learn more about the slug concept](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clean_URL#Slug).

oneOf.description: The value of the attribute given in current locale determined by context of the API request.

description.description: A brief description. The [Markdown](http://commonmark.org/help/) is very welcome for formatting

oneOf.description: The value of the attribute given in current locale determined by context of the API request.

element.description: Target element the alert is related to.

width.description: Width of the media content. Mostly applicable for pictures, videos and 3D media.

height.description: Height of the media content. Mostly applicable for pictures, videos and 3D media.

depth.description: Depth of the media content. Mostly applicable for 3D media.

duration.description: Duration of the media content in milliseconds or as a string like "1:15:30.145". Mostly applicable for videos and audio tracks.

caption.description: A plain text caption that represents the object.

oneOf.description: The value of the attribute given in current locale determined by context of the API request.

Preview.description: The `Preview` of the object, which allows to give a textual and visual explanation about it without having its data fetched.

locale.description: Response locale as [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) in format specified by [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646) (language-TERRITORY).

alerts.description: The alerts issued with the response.

tenant.description: The tenant to which the origin is belongs to.

key.description: The natural key of captured object.

model.description: The logical model of captured object.

type.description: The physical type of captured object.

length.description: The length of captured object in bytes.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the captured object has been created or last modified in the 3rd party system in [ISO-8601 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`..

containments.description: Data samples where current captured object is contained.

overlaps.description: Data samples where attributes from current captured object are overlapped.

provenances.description: Data samples where current captured object is a parent source.

synonyms.description: Data samples with the same semantic meanings as a captured object.

anomalies.description: Data sample anomalies like duplicates, broken versions of the same captured object.

characteristics.description: References from captured origin to another origins from 3rd party systems.

schema.description: The schematic metadata of captured object.

items.description: The semantic tags of captured object.

text.description: The semantic text description of captured object.

duration.description: The duration of the `Timeframe` given in milliseconds or as a string like "4h30m", "1d", etc.

start.description: The start of the `Timeframe` specified in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

end.description: The end of the `Timeframe` specified in [ISO-8601] (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

timeframe.description: The timeframe of the captured data.

protocol.description: The protocol that was used for the capture.

driver.description: The driver that was used for the capture.

context.description: The context that conditioned the capture.

host.description: The host that was served the capture.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of a system API or file storage or database connection string that was used for the capture.

request.description: The request that was made for the capture.

navigation.description: The details about how origin was captured from 3rd party system.

accesses.description: Access levels of captured origin from 3rd party system.

sensitivity.description: The sensitivity level from 0..10 of captured origin from 3rd party system.

security.description: The sensitivity and access levels of captured origin from 3rd party system.

capture.description: The information describing metadata about the origin and how it was captured.

versions.description: The collection of every version that the Origin has.

oneOf.description: The url of different from json data captured.

type.description: The type of the source like 'system', 'database', 'file-system', etc.

footprint.description: The source settings snapshot that may helps to identify the 3rd party system.

path.description: The [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) compliant path specifying certain part of the target object (JSON document) to operate on.

value.description: The value to add, replace or test.

from.description: The [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) compliant path pointing to the location to move/copy from.

model.description: The type of captured object from 3rd party system.

key.description: The natural key of captured object from 3rd party system.
